Name: The King's Arms
Notes: Probably residential initially, later and now, an inn.

Name: The Old George Inn
Notes: This old inn has a number of literary and historical connections, now, with ground floor removed, entrance to shopping mall. No longer an inn.

Name: Church House
Notes: Originally donated by the Audley family as a workhouse, now diocesan administrative offices.

Name: Joiners' Hall
Notes: Initially a guild meeting hall, now residential

Name: Mill House and Old Mill
Notes: Mill house, restored early 19th century, now with hotel attached.

Name: School of Arts Annexe
Notes: Originally part of Salisbury School of Art, now offices.

Name: The Poultry Cross
Notes: Originally to mark the site of a market. Still used as a market site twice weekly.

Name: Trinity Street Almshouses
Notes: 2 storied medieval hospital and accommodation rebuilt in 1702, now accommodation for elderly people.

Name: Harnham Bridge or Ayleswade Bridge
Notes: The oldest bridge in Salisbury. Built by Bishop Bingham over the River Avon

Name: Remains of Old Sarum Castle and Cathedral
Notes: Originally an important town and citadel, now a historical site.
